jobs at Microsoft, with new blood coming in to run the key business units- prompted by Microsoft's misreading of some of the biggest technology trends of recent times, most notably smartphones and tablets. Over the past year we've seen the departure of many of the Microsoft old guard- including chief software architect Ray Ozzie and server and tools chief Bob Muglia- in preparation for the reshuffle. Steve Ballmer has been spearheading this effort and we don't see any change in his commitment to the company he's led for the past 11 years, he added. The group blasted Eric Schmidt for his handling of recent privacy concerns, in particular the Wi-Fi data scandal. the past. Howard Stern to David Letterman : sorry about your sex scandal( video) Instead of deflecting Howard Stern 's apology, David Letterman responded with candor and a bit of reciprocal praise. "You have been very, very nice to me on the radio and viciously ugly to me on the radio and I except both with equanimity because I know a little bit about how you operate and I'm still fond of your talent and your ability and what you've represented to the United States of America-and of course, the world." . In March, when the New York Times reported on the fracturing relationship between Apple and Google, Steve Jobs declined to comment. Eric Schmidt , meanwhile, was anything but cold, calculating, and distant. I continue to believe, as many do, that Steve Jobs is the best CEO in the world today, and I admire Apple and Steve Jobs enormously, Eric Schmidt declared. Is Schmidt-and, by extension, Google-tough enough to stay on top in tech? People have been asking this question about Google for years, but rarely has it mattered as much as it does
